alert.note: Alert for Angelina; Cherokee; Nacogdoches (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 26 at 6:16PM CDT until further notice by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Shreveport LA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Angelina River Near Alto affecting Cherokee, Angelina and Nacogdoches Counties. For the Angelina River...including Alto, Lufkin...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE SATURDAY NIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Angelina River Near Alto. * WHEN...From late Saturday night until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, Expect lowland flooding of the river bottom. Ranchers that have cattle and equipment near the river should move them to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Sunday morning and continue rising to a crest of 29.7 feet early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 29.7 feet on 03/13/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Thursday evening at 630 PM CDT.
